article.headline: West Virginia 95, Oakland, Mich. 71
article.story: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. -- John Flowers set a career high of 16 points and blocked seven shots to lead West Virginia to a 95-71 victory over Oakland on Friday night. Casey Mitchell, Deniz Kilicli and Darryl Bryant added 12 points apiece and Joe Mazzula added 15 for the Mountaineers. Keith Benson scored 22 points and grabbed 15 rebounds for Oakland, which played its first game since its NCAA tournament berth last March. West Virginia shot 50.8 percent and had 13 turnovers. The inside game of the Golden Grizzlies also gave West Virginia trouble, as Oakland scored 38 of its 71 points in the paint and shot 17 free throws. The victory marks the 14th consecutive win in season openers for the Mountaineers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
